To solve for x, we will first get rid of the fraction by multiplying both sides of the equation by (x - 2):

(3x + 1)/(x - 2) * (x - 2) = 2 * (x - 2)

The (x - 2) on the left side of the equation will cancel out:

3x + 1 = 2 * (x - 2)

Now, distribute the 2 on the right side of the equation:

3x + 1 = 2x - 4

Next, subtract 2x from both sides of the equation:

3x - 2x + 1 = 2x - 2x - 4

This simplifies to:

x + 1 = -4

Finally, subtract 1 from both sides of the equation:

x + 1 - 1 = -4 - 1

This gives us the solution:

x = -5
